node.title: Bosses and Workers Face N.Y.C.’s New Reality: Get Vaccinated or Else
node.alt: Workers and business owners grappled on Tuesday with the news that all of the city’s private employers would soon be subject to a vaccination mandate.
node.description: After Mayor Bill de Blasio set a mandate for all private employers, some raised questions about how the city planned to enforce it, while others said they backed the idea.
node.content: ["The owner of a flower shop in the Bronx applauded New York City\u2019s new vaccine mandate for private employers. A worker at a tire shop in Brooklyn said she was not ready to get vaccinated. Major companies like News Corp that currently require vaccination or weekly testing were considering how to implement the measure.", "The day after Mayor Bill de Blasio announced a vaccine mandate for on-site employees at all private businesses \u2014 the most far-reaching local measure in the country \u2014 workers across the city were figuring out what it would mean for them.", "Some business leaders raised concerns about the difficulty of enforcing the measure, whether the city had the power to enact the mandate and whether it could lead to worker shortages.", "Mr. de Blasio defended the mandate in a series of television interviews on Tuesday, describing it as a necessary step to combat a fresh wave of coronavirus cases this winter amid growing concern over the Omicron variant, without returning to harsh restrictions that were used early in the pandemic.", "\u201cWhat we\u2019ve heard from business leaders is, whatever you do, don\u2019t let us go back to a shutdown, don\u2019t let us go backward,\u201d Mr. de Blasio said in an interview on CNN.", "The mandate takes effect on Dec. 27 and applies to workers at about 184,000 businesses. Mr. de Blasio said that businesses could face penalties if they did not comply, and that the city would offer medical and religious exemptions for employees whose reasons were deemed valid.", "In the Bronx, Chris Blanis, the owner of Mount Eden Florist, said the mandate was a good idea that would help keep New Yorkers safe. He and his only employee, his son, are both already fully vaccinated.", "\u201cWe want to live \u2014 we don\u2019t want to die,\u201d Mr. Blanis said as he prepared a bouquet of red roses and pink lilies, wrapped up with 30 one-hundred dollar bills, for a customer\u2019s 30th birthday.", "In the Williamsburg neighborhood in Brooklyn, Lilibeth Diaz, who works at Tom Goma Tire Shop, said that she had not yet been vaccinated and that she opposed the mandate.", "\u201cI just think they shouldn\u2019t be obligating nobody to do that, because that\u2019s nobody\u2019s business,\u201d she said.", "Several large financial-services companies based in the city \u2014 including some of the world\u2019s largest banks like Citi, Bank of America, Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs \u2014 already had policies requiring employees to be fully vaccinated before returning to the office. Citi called employees back to its New York headquarters at least two days a week starting in mid-September.", "Media and advertising companies that are based in the city have varied policies. A spokesman for the newspaper publisher News Corp, which owns The Wall Street Journal and The New York Post, where employees must be vaccinated or tested weekly, said it was \u201cin the process of assessing\u201d the new mandate. ", "A New York Times spokeswoman said that people entering company offices in New York already must be vaccinated or officially exempt, and that the printing plant in College Point, Queens, which has mandatory Covid screening and masking, is expected to have the same requirement \u201csoon.\u201d", "A spokeswoman for the advertising giant Omnicom said the company, which had already required all U.S. employees to get vaccinated if they wanted to work in person, was \u201ccurrently evaluating\u201d the new mandate and \u201cawaiting more details.\u201d", "Randy Peers, chief executive of the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce, described the mandate as \u201cvirtually unenforceable\u201d and said it would \u201cmean more pain for the city\u2019s economy.\u201d", "He added: \u201cIt sets up problematic confrontations between employers and staff, which could result in layoffs around the holidays that would be incredibly unfortunate.\u201d", "The measure is likely to face a legal challenge from business groups or conservative leaders who opposed past measures.", "The city plans to release detailed guidelines about how officials will enforce the vaccine mandate by Dec. 15, after consulting with business leaders.", "Mr. de Blasio said the new mandate would be enforced in much the same way as the vaccine mandate for indoor dining, entertainment and gyms that took effect in September. But that measure \u2014 which affected the city\u2019s 25,000 restaurants \u2014 has relied mostly on encouragement rather than harsh penalties.", "\u201cWe had almost no fines,\u201d Mr. de Blasio said on CNN. \u201cThere was a lot of cooperation.\u201d", "The city has completed 51,900 inspections since the start of the policy, which is known as the \u201cKey to NYC,\u201d city officials said. Those inspections led to 4,100 warnings for first violations and 31 fines for second violations, costing businesses $1,000 each. The fines can rise as high as $5,000 if a business does not comply with the mandate.", "City officials hope that the new measure will dramatically expand the reach of vaccine mandates, including to those who work in the city but live in the suburbs in New Jersey, Long Island and Westchester County. One city official said the goal was to get \u201ceveryone who breathes New York City air\u201d vaccinated.", "Mr. de Blasio has gradually expanded vaccine mandates \u2014 to health care workers, teachers, police officers and employees at private and religious schools. One group of workers in the city that has been left out is transit workers, who are not required to get vaccinated because their employer, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, is overseen by Gov. Kathy Hochul, who has declined to require them to get vaccinated.", "About 72 percent of transit workers have uploaded proof of vaccination, according to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.", "On Tuesday, Mr. de Blasio called on Ms. Hochul to set a mandate for transit workers.", "\u201cI certainly would urge the state government \u2014 require your employees, all kinds of your employees to get vaccinated because it makes us all safer,\u201d he said. \u201cAnd by the way, a lot of state employees, of course, come in contact with everyday New Yorkers all the time.\u201d", "Some business leaders oppose the new policy. Mickey King, the owner of Antun\u2019s, a large catering hall in Queens Village, said that after the city announced its mandate for restaurants in August, some of his clients immediately canceled plans to host nonprofit fund-raisers there and relocated to event spaces in nearby Nassau County on Long Island.", "The clients were concerned, he said, about unvaccinated donors being unable to attend. At the time, Mr. King also had an employee who was worried about getting vaccinated because she was pregnant, even though studies have shown that the vaccines are safe during pregnancy.", "\u201cI wouldn\u2019t have fired a pregnant employee if my life depended on it,\u201d Mr. King said.", "Mr. King said he lost \u201ca handful\u201d of employees as a result of the vaccine mandate, out of a total staff of about 60. He bristled in particular at new rules requiring him to check the vaccination status of children as young as 5.", "\u201cThat is not my job to tell little kids what to do,\u201d he said. \u201cI\u2019m not telling people don\u2019t get vaccinated, but the city has to stop harassing small businesses.\u201d", "Joe Schwartz, the manager of Satmar Meat Market in the Borough Park neighborhood in Brooklyn, home to the lowest vaccination rate in the city, said he thought the mayor was going too far.", "\u201cHe doesn\u2019t have any right,\u201d said Mr. Schwartz, who said he was vaccinated. \u201cThat\u2019s not his job. He should be busy with the city to make sure crime is down.\u201d", "At Drug Mart Pharmacy not far away, Ihsan Chahin, the owner, said that his employees were mostly college students who already had to be vaccinated to attend classes. But he said he thought the mandate could worsen worker shortages at other businesses.", "\u201cYou got to give people a choice,\u201d he said.", "But other workers interviewed on Tuesday, including Hasib Hossain, the pharmacist at NVR Pharmacy in the Mount Eden neighborhood in the Bronx, said they supported the new policy.", "\u201cEverybody at my pharmacy is already vaccinated,\u201d he said. \u201cBut if they weren\u2019t, this would have made my job a lot easier, because I want all my employees to be vaccinated.\u201d", "Khaleem Majid, a barber at Mike\u2019s Barber Shop a block away, is also fully vaccinated. He said that while he had mixed feelings about the mandate, he ultimately thought it was a good idea.", "\u201cI hate the point when they\u2019re like, OK, you have to get vaccinated or you are getting fired,\u201d Mr. Majid said. \u201cBut also, hey, you\u2019re going to bring a virus and infect everybody in the job.\u201d"]
